page.title: 19BYEGONE DAYS, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: Mr.Tom Bucknall,now aged 73,came to {Grainthorpe Hall}in 1916. His father farmed 250 acres employing 3 men,plus a housemaid. Tom went to{school}on Taffy,a pony.He remembers - seeing an {aeroplane}in 1916,{ steamers}on the {Louth Navigation Canal}and{"Fasten {Penny"},when farmers hired workers in Louth Market place and sealed it with a shilling.He left school at 14 and worked on a farm.Then a year in { {Grainthorpe Mill}at 3 shillings a day ,followed by a lifetime's farming. He has rung the {Church bells}for 61 years,and also sung in the {choir}and mown the{churchyard}.During the {last {war}he was on the Intelligence Staff of the{Home Guard}.He thinks that the village was more closely knit years ago,due to the influx of newcomers.
